items.title: F&O Ban List: SAIL, GNFC among 10 stocks under trade ban on Wednesday
items.description: Ten stocks, including Bandhan Bank, Birlasoft, and PNB, are banned from F&O trading due to high open interest exceeding 95% of the market-wide position limits. The ban is reversed if open interest drops below 80%. Indian indices rebounded driven by HDFC Bank and Reliance Industries ahead of RBI policy decisions.

items.title: Big movers on D-Street: What should investors do with Trent, Sobha and SpiceJet?
items.description: Sensex and Nifty recovered after a six-day slump with major gains in Trent, Sobha, and SpiceJet. Trent's stock shows potential for further upside, Sobha is seen as a good long-term buy, while SpiceJet is recommended to be avoided due to low trading volumes.

items.title: Being bullish is not a weakness, just learn to tackle volatility: 7 mid-cap stocks from different sectors with an upside potential of up to 37%
items.description: After last week’s sharp correction, the street is bound to grapple with its own fears and anxieties. Will the correction spill over to the mid-caps? Will it continue, both in terms of price cuts and time? There is a likelihood that as the Q2 season kicks off,  the mid-cap segment will witness some profit-booking/rational shifting/consolidation. Many sub-segments may be formed in this space – and given the mix of head and tailwinds, this segmentation is likely to remain till there is clarity on how China emerges. So, if you are putting in fresh money, be selective and focus on managing risks. Hedge for the short term, and think from a long-term perspective.

items.title: Wall Street ends higher on tech buying as investors wait on inflation data
items.description: Wall Street's benchmarks saw a rebound driven by tech stocks as investors eyed upcoming inflation data and third-quarter earnings. Lower Treasury yields favored high-growth tech companies. Major indexes like the S&P 500, Nasdaq, and Dow Jones showed gains. Key indicators include the recent jobs report and anticipated CPI data for interest rate predictions.

items.title: GIFT Nifty up 45 points; here's the trading setup for today's session
items.description: A decisive move above 25,000 levels could possibly open the next upside resistance of 25,400-25,500 in the near term. Immediate support is at 24,700, said Nagaraj Shetti of HDFC Securities.

items.title: Asian stocks advance after tech lifts Wall Street
items.description: Shares in Australia and Japan rose as did Hong Kong equity futures following sharp declines on Tuesday. US equity futures dropped after the S&P 500 rose 1% and the tech-heavy Nasdaq 100 advanced 1.6% Tuesday. Chipmakers were among the market leaders with Nvidia Corp. extending a five-day rally to 14%.

items.title: Stocks in news: Adani Green, Infosys, Torrent Power, Dr Reddy's, JSW Infra
items.description: The IT services company expanded its four year collaboration with Old National Bank to accelerate the Bank’s operational and technological transformation.

items.title: Parliamentary Finance Panel calls Sebi, other regulators
items.description: This was decided at the first meeting of the parliamentary finance panel on Tuesday, which was attended by around two-dozen MPs and chaired by BJP MP Bhartruhari Mahtab. Former FM and senior Congress leader P Chidambaram is a part of the 31-member panel.

items.title: Good Q2 tidings for life insurers, claims to hit others
items.description: General insurance companies are likely to see a slowdown in premium income due to muted growth in the motor segment. Also, the claims from natural catastrophes are going to affect the overall profitability of insurance companies. At the same time, standalone health insurance companies are likely to see higher claims due to seasonal diseases and medical inflation.

items.title: Biocon Biologics raises $300 million for debt refinancing
items.description: The loan was priced at 175 basis points above the three-month secured overnight funding rate (SOFR), which was trading at 4.59%. That pegs the floating-rate loan at 6.34%, people familiar with the matter said.

items.title: Nifty's over 4% falls in a week mostly recovered within 3 months: Study
items.description: Mid-cap and small-cap stocks also fell in such periods, tracking the benchmark indices. In the subsequent three months, the mid-cap index rose seven times and fell thrice, while the small-cap index gained six times and declined four times.

items.title: D-Street ends 6-Day losing streak as China stocks retreat from highs
items.description: Elsewhere in Asia, China advanced 4.6%, while Hong Kong, considered a proxy for China in the past week because of the holiday in mainland markets, plunged 9.4%, the biggest single-day fall since 2008. South Korea declined 0.6% and Taiwan dropped 0.4%.

items.title: Tata powers up wind energy market with mega order; seeks bids for supply of turbines with capacity of 3 GW
items.description: Tata Power is pursuing bids for wind turbines to equip its wind-solar hybrid renewable energy projects, expecting to install over 3GW with a potential expansion to 5GW over five years. Major manufacturers like Siemens Gamesa and Suzlon are involved, with investments estimated at $9 billion.

items.title: Sebi calls for stricter review of AIF investors
items.description: At present, AIFs have been designated as qualified institutional buyers(QIB) and can avail certain benefits under Sebi rules. On Tuesday, Sebi said AIFs should not facilitate investors who are ineligible for QIB status on their own from availing the benefits.

items.title: Stock Radar: Max Healthcare stock is down 17% from September 2024 highs; should you buy the dip?
items.description: Max Healthcare Institute Ltd's stock has dropped over 17% from its September 2024 peak to Rs 919 but is showing potential for a technical rebound. Support is indicated around the 50-DMA and 100-DMA, with experts suggesting short-term buying for a possible target range of Rs 980-Rs 1045.

items.title: These 8 bank stocks can give 27 to 38% returns in 1 year, according to analysts
items.description: In the last few sessions, every bank stock has seen a correction. But a deeper look reveals a streak of outperformance amidst the mayhem. The wave of unprecedented FPI selling was bound to hit all indices. Had it happened a couple of years ago, it would have caused much more damage, especially to banking stocks where FPIs own significant chunks. The current wave of selling resulted in just a 5% cut in the index, with a few large-caps taking a beating. But when the recovery took place on Tuesday, the market breadth was able to recover sharply. This indicates the strength of the market. Check out Stock Reports Plus, powered by Refinitiv, for price targets of over 4,000 listed stocks along with detailed company analysis focusing on five key components – earnings, fundamentals, relative valuation, risk, and price momentum – to generate standardized scores. SR+ Reports is a complimentary offering to ETPrime members.

items.title: Bullish Momentum: 3 Nifty stocks with White Marubozu Pattern on Oct 8
Stock to watch: Tata Power stock in focus as it seeks bids for 3 GW wind turbine supply to boost renewable energy facilities
items.description: Tata Motors will capture attention as Tata Power seeks over 3 GW of wind turbines for its hybrid energy facilities, with potential orders exceeding Rs 21,000 crore. Bidders include Siemens Gamesa and Suzlon Energy. Plans aim for 20 GW capacity by 2030, as Tata Power shifts towards 100% clean energy by FY45.

items.title: Sensex gains 200 points ahead of RBI MPC outcome, Nifty above 25K
items.description: Indian blue-chip indices Nifty50 and BSE Sensex opened higher for the second consecutive day, driven by gains in auto and IT stocks. This rise comes ahead of the Reserve Bank of India's policy meeting, where the central bank is anticipated to maintain current interest rates while adopting a hawkish stance.

items.title: Will the stock market crash? Let's find out using 6-day stress test
items.description: After a significant 1,420-point drop in Nifty over six days, historical trends show potential for recovery, bolstered by domestic institutional and retail investors. A six-day consecutive fall has often led to positive returns, suggesting short-term declines may offer strategic buying opportunities.

items.title: Hot Stocks: Brokerage view on HDFC Bank, SBI and IGL
items.description: CLSA maintains a hold rating on HDFC Bank with a target price of Rs 1,725, while Nomura and Citi have buy ratings for SBI and IGL, respectively. HDFC Bank faces a dilemma akin to Shakespeare's Hamlet, choosing to sell down loans to address its high loan-deposit ratio, though this approach may not effectively repair its balance sheet and comes at the cost of profits.

items.title: Golden Crossovers: These 5 stocks signal further bullishness on Oct 9
items.description: In the NSE list of stocks, five stocks with a market cap of over Rs 1000 crore are witnessing Golden Crossovers, according to stockedge.com's technical scan data. Golden Cross is an important technical indicator of bullishness. It occurs when the short-term moving average crosses over the major long-term moving average on the upside. These stocks' 50-day simple moving averages (SMA) crossed their 200-day SMAs on October 8.

items.title: Stock Radar: Max Healthcare trading in an upward rising channel; time to buy the dip?
items.description: “On the daily chart, Max Healthcare stock is trading within an upward rising channel, indicating a sustained positive trend. Traders can buy for a target of Rs 980-1045 in the next 3-4 weeks,” Kkunal V. Parar, Vice-President of Technical Research and Algo, Choice Broking, said.

items.title: Positive Breakout: These 3 Nifty stocks close cross above their 200 DMAs
items.description: In the Nifty50 pack, three stocks' close prices crossed above their 200 DMA (Daily Moving Averages) on October 8, according to stockedge.com's technical scan data.

items.title: Stock to watch: Edelweiss Financial in focus as co announces Rs 200 crore NCDs
items.description: Edelweiss Financial Services has launched a Rs 200 crore public issue of Secured Redeemable Non-Convertible Debentures (NCDs), offering yields of up to 11% per annum. With 12 series of NCDs, the funds will primarily be used to repay existing borrowings. The issue opens on October 7 and will be listed on BSE.

items.title: NeoPolitan Pizza shares to debut today. GMP hints at flat listing
items.description: NeoPolitan Pizza and Foods' shares debut on the BSE SME platform with a flat to negative listing due to a grey market premium of Rs 0. Proceeds from the offering will support retail network expansion and working capital. The company operates in QSR and agricultural trading, with revenues of Rs 44.01 crore and a net profit of Rs 2.

items.title: Stock to watch: JSW Infrastructure shares in focus after MD & CEO steps down
items.description: JSW Infrastructure announced the resignation of Arun Maheshwari as its Managing Director and CEO. Maheshwari, shifting roles within the JSW group, will stay on as a Non-Executive Director until November 7, 2024. Shares of JSW Infrastructure closed at Rs 323.45 after a recent gain, having outperformed the market significantly over the last year.

items.title: Stock to watch: Adani Green shares in focus on report of co's plan to raise up to $1 billion by issue of dollar-denominated bonds
items.description: Adani Green Energy's subsidiaries plan to raise up to $1 billion through US dollar-denominated bonds this month. The bonds will have a 20-year maturity and be issued in multiple tranches. The company recently raised $409 million through bonds and reported a significant increase in net profit and total income in the recent quarter.

items.title: China stock rally fizzles as stimulus optimism fades; Shanghai Composite slides 5%
items.description: Mainland China stocks plummet, breaking a 10-day winning streak, as officials fail to boost confidence in stimulus plans aimed at reviving the economy. The Shanghai Composite index drops 5.3%, while property and tourism sectors see significant declines amid disappointing Golden Week spending figures. Mainland China stocks fell sharply Wednesday, ending a 10-day winning streak due to uninspiring stimulus plans. The Shanghai Composite and CSI300 indices saw significant drops, while turnover hit a record high.

items.title: Stock to watch: Infosys shares in focus on expansion of partnership with Old National Bank
items.description: Infosys has expanded its collaboration with Old National Bank to accelerate the bank's operational and technological transformation. Leveraging automation and GenAI, the partnership aims to enhance process digitization, stability, and client experience. The alliance emphasizes efficiency and value generation, supporting Old National’s growth and resilience.
